授業目的: The objective of this course is for the students to comprehend the financial reporting environment and to understand and analyze the financial statements of organizations for economic decision-making.
到達目標:
Upon successful completion of the requirements for this course, students will be able to:
a) comprehend the financial accounting and reporting environment
b) read, understand, interpret and analyze the financial statements
c) understand the alternative accounting policies and their impact on financial statements
d) analyze financial statements from the viewpoints of investors, creditors and management
e) apply different tools and techniques such as ratio analysis, cash flow analysis, and forecasting techniques to assess the performance of companies and assist the users in making economic decisions
f) understand the recent development in corporate reporting such as sustainability reporting and integrated reporting
授業方法:
The course will be offered using "Online Format: Simultaneous and Two-way". Classes will be held at the time specified in the timetable via interactive live streaming using Zoom.
Study materials (i.e., power point slides, exercises, and home assignment) will be uploaded in LUNA one week in advance. Students are strongly encouraged to read the materials before joining the class. It would be helpful to note down the key concepts in each chapter to discuss in the class.
In each session, at first the instructor will clarify the key concepts of a chapter/case to the students. Then, the students will solve a number of related problems. This process will ensure that the students acquire adequate technical competencies as well as comprehend the underlying rationale and effectiveness of accounting practices.
Individual assignments will be from end-of-chapter problems. On average, students should spend 3/4 hours working on each assignment. All homework assignments must be submitted to the instructor by e-mail. Students are required to identify difficulties while solving problems and to communicate them so that the instructor can discuss them.
Case analysis is a proven tool for developing students’ critical thinking and problem solving skills. Therefore, success in this course significantly depends on the ability to analyze the given case studies.
Final Report: Students are required to submit a final report by analyzing the financial performance and financial condition of a selected company. The length of the report should be 15 pages (approximately).
